column2: Self-motivated and self-oriented. A preference for mapping out a personal life path, with difficulties arising when others create obstacles. Independence and solitude are highly valued. Enjoyment of social company is conditional on having freedom for personal pursuits. A potential for egocentric and selfish behavior.

Identity and personal resources form the basis for all other success. A need for inner security before engaging with the external world. Family roots and the home environment provide the foundation for self-discovery and self-knowledge, supporting future success. A risk of becoming too insular or home-bound.

Interactions with others play a paramount role. High value is placed on both personal relationships and broader human interaction. A gift for mediation, stemming from an insight into the nuances of relationships. Self-knowledge is primarily gained through relationships. A vulnerability to being engulfed in stifling relationships.

Public life is of pinnacle importance. Personal satisfaction is gained from worldly achievements, and self-knowledge comes through a public role. A need for a high public profile, which can be met through career and social status. A risk of achievements coming at the expense of personal relationships.
